translation: to intend, to plan (to do something)
note:
Minä aion mennä. - I plan to go.
Sinä aiot opiskella. - You intend to study.
usage: Used with another verb in the basic infinitive (like mennä, opiskella, tehdä, etc.)

translation: to drive, to ride, or to operate a vehicle
note:
Minä ajan autoa. - I drive a(some) car.
Minä ajan autolla kotiin. - I drive home by car.
Sinä ajat parran. - You shave (your) beard.
usage: To drive a vehicle(car, motorcycle), to ride (bike), or even to cut or to shave in some specific contexts.

note:
Kurssi alkaa huomenna. - The course starts tomorrow.
Minä alan opiskella. - I start studying.
usage: Used when the subject itself begins doing something, or when something starts by itself (like a movie or rain).

translation: to give, to allow, to let
note:
Minä annan sinulle kirjan. - I give you a book.
Sinä annat minulle kynän. - You give me a pen.
usage: A giver (subject), a receiver (indirect object, usually in allative: -lle), a thing being given (direct object). Formal analogue: 'sallia'

note:
Minä asun Helsingissä. - I live in Helsinki.
Sinä asut pienessä talossa. - You live in a small house.
usage: Used to indicate where a person lives, or where something is located.

note:
Minä autan sinua. - I help you.
Voinko auttaa sinua siivouksessa? - Can I help you with the cleaning?
Autatko sinä minua? - Do you help me?
usage: A helper (subject), a person being helped (indirect object, usually in allative: -lle), a thing being helped (direct object).

translation: to have time to, to make it (in time)
note:
Minä ehdin lukea kirjan. - I have time to read the book.
Hän ehti pelastaa koiran. - He/she managed to save the dog (in time).
Minä ehdin bussiin juuri ja juuri. - I barely made it to the bus.
usage: Used to indicate that there is enough time to do something.

note:
Minä etsin avaimia. - I am looking for the keys.
Sinä etsit työtä. - You are looking for a job.
usage: Used when trying to find something or someone.

translation: to take / pick up something or someone / to apply for something
note:
Minä haen sinut bussipysäkiltä. - I will pick you up from the bus stop.
Sinä haet töitä. - You are applying for a job.
usage: Used when going to get something or someone, or when applying for something.

note:
Minä herätän sinut. - I wake you up.
Opettaja herätti kiinnostuksen. - The teacher sparked interest.
usage: Transitive verb → it needs an object (someone/something that is being woken up). Different from 'herätä - to wake up'.

note:
Minä herään kello seitsemän. - I wake up at seven o'clock.
Hän herää. - He/she wakes up.
usage: Intransitive verb → it does not take an object. Different from 'herättää - to wake up someone/something'.

translation: to take care of, to handle, to manage, to treat (medically)
note:
Minä hoidan koiraa. - I take care of the dog.
Hän hoitaa sairaita. - He/she treats the sick.
usage: Needs an object (what are you taking care of?). Taking care of people or animals; handling tasks; managing something (like paperwork or errands).

note:
Minä huudan apua. - I shout for help.
Hän huutaa kovaa. - He/she yells loudly.
usage: Used when expressing something loudly, often in distress or excitement.

note:
Minä katson televisiota. - I watch television.
Hän katsoo elokuvaa. - He/she is watching a movie.
usage: Used when observing something visually, like a movie, TV show, or scenery.

note:
Minä kiellän sinua tekemästä sitä. - I forbid you from doing that.
Hän kieltää tupakoinnin. - He/she prohibits smoking.
usage: Used when someone is not allowed to do something, when something is not permitted, denies something is true, or refuses to accept something.

translation: to turn, to rotate, to go around
note:
Minä kierrän nurkan. - I turn the corner.
Hän kiertää maapallon. - He/she goes around the Earth.
usage: Used when changing direction, rotating an object, or going around something.

note:
Minä kirjoitan kirjeen. - I write a letter.
Hän kirjoittaa runon. - He/she writes a poem.
usage: Used when composing text, like letters, emails, or documents.

note:
Minä kysyn sinulta. - I ask you.
Hän kysyy kysymyksen. - He/she asks a question.
usage: Used when seeking information or clarification from someone.

translation: to expand, to enlarge, to widen, to broaden
note:
Minä laajennan liiketoimintaa. - I expand the business.
Hän laajentaa tietämystään. - He/she enlarges their knowledge.
usage: Used in: physical space (buildings, roads), abstract ideas (knowledge, vocabulary, business, reach, etc.).

translation: to leave, to depart, to go away
note:
Minä lähden kotiin. - I leave for home.
Juna lähtee kello kahdeksan. - The train leaves at eight o’clock.
usage: Used when someone is going away from a place, starting a journey, or leaving a situation.

translation: to put, to place, to set
note:
Minä laitan kirjan pöydälle. - I put the book on the table.
Hän laittaa kengät jalkaan. - He/she puts on shoes.
usage: Used when placing something somewhere, setting up an object, or putting on clothes.

translation: to count, to lower, to go down, or to descend
note:
Minä lasken rahaa. - I count money.
Lämpötila laskee. - The temperature goes down.
usage: Used when performing arithmetic operations, counting items, or lowering something (like a price).

note:
Minä luen kirjaa. - I read a book.
Hän lukee lehteä. - He/she reads a newspaper.
usage: Used when engaging with written text, like books, articles, or documents.

note:
Minä maksan laskun. - I pay the bill.
Hän maksaa paljon rahaa. - He/she pays a lot of money.
usage: Used when giving money, or when referring to the cost of something.

note:
Minä muistan sinut. - I remember you.
Hän muistaa tapahtuman. - He/she recalls the event.
usage: Used when retaining information or recalling past experiences.

translation: to advise, to give directions, to instruct
note:
Minä neuvon sinua. - I advise you.
Hän neuvoo opiskelussa. - He/she counsels in studies.
usage: Giving advice or instructions, telling someone how to get somewhere, or giving helpful tips.

note:
Minä odotan bussia. - I wait for the bus.
Hän odottaa tuloksia. - He/she expects results.
usage: Used when staying in a place until something happens or someone arrives.

note:
Minä ostan leipää kaupasta. - I buy bread from the store.
Hän ostaa uuden auton. - He/she buys a new car.
usage: Used when acquiring goods or services in exchange for money.

translation: to take, to grab, to catch
note:
Minä otan kirjan hyllystä. - I take the book from the shelf.
Hän ottaa valokuvan. - He/she takes a photo.
usage: Used when physically taking something, or when accepting an offer or opportunity.

translation: to fry, to bake, to shine (like the sun)
note:
Minä paistan kananmunan. - I fry an egg.
Hän paistaa leipää uunissa. - He/she bakes bread in the oven.
usage: Used when cooking food by frying or baking, or when the sun shines.

note:
Minä puhun suomea. - I speak Finnish.
Hän puhuu ystävälleen. - He/she talks to a friend.
usage: Used when communicating verbally, either in a conversation or a speech.

note:
Minä rakastan sinua. - I love you.
Hän rakastaa musiikkia. - He/she loves music.
usage: Transitive verb → requires an object (you love someone or something). Used to express deep affection or strong liking for someone or something.

note:
Minä rakastun sinuun. - I fall in love with you.
Hän rakastuu nopeasti. - He/she falls in love quickly.
usage: Intransitive verb, but followed by illative case (you fall in love into someone). Used to describe the process of developing romantic feelings for someone.

note:
Minä sallin sinun mennä. - I allow you to go.
Hän sallii lasten leikkiä. - He/she allows children to play.
usage: Transitive verb: you allow something/someone to do something. A bit more official than 'antaa'. Used when giving permission for something to happen or allowing someone to do something.

note:
Minä sanon sinulle totuuden. - I tell you the truth.
Hän sanoo, että tulee myöhässä. - He/she says that they will be late.
usage: Used when expressing something verbally, making a statement, or giving information.

translation: to play (an instrument), to call (on the phone)
note:
Minä soitan kitaraa. - I play the guitar.
Hän soittaa minulle. - He/she calls me.
usage: To call by phone, to play an instrument. Less commonly: to ring/buzz (doorbell).

translation: to collapse, to give in, to cave in, to fall (into something negative)
note:
Minä sorruin paineeseen. - I collapsed under pressure.
Hän sortuu lopulta. - He/she eventually gives in.
usage: Used when something fails, or when someone gives in to pressure. Often used figuratively: to fall into temptation, to relapse, to succumb.

translation: to know, to be aware of
note:
Minä tiedän vastauksen. - I know the answer.
Hän tietää asian. - He/she is aware of the matter.
usage: Used when having knowledge or information about something, being aware of facts, or understanding a situation.

translation: to feel, to know (someone), to be familiar with
note:
Minä tunnen sinut hyvin. - I know you well.
Hän tuntee surua. - He/she feels sadness.
usage: Used when having an emotional experience, or when being acquainted with someone or something. Transitive verb: you feel something or know someone.

note:
Minä unohdan avaimet kotiin. - I forget the keys at home.
Hän unohtaa nimen. - He/she forgets the name.
usage: Used when failing to remember something, or when something is not recalled.

note:
Minä unohdan sinut. - I forget you.
Hän unohtaa paikan. - He/she forgets the place.
usage: Transitive verb: it needs an object. Used when failing to remember something, or when something is not recalled.

translation: to be forgotten, to slip one's mind
note:
Minä unohdun tähän paikkaan. - I get forgotten in this place.
Hän unohtuu nopeasti. - He/she slips their mind quickly.
usage: Intransitive verb: it does not take an object. Used when something is forgotten or overlooked, often without intention.

translation: to demand, to require, to insist on
note:
Minä vaadin oikeutta. - I demand justice.
Hän vaatii selitystä. - He/she requires an explanation.
usage: Often used in formal speech, legal official contexts.

note:
Minä ymmärrän sinua. - I understand you.
Hän ymmärtää asian. - He/she comprehends the matter.
usage: Used when grasping the meaning of something, comprehending information, or having insight into a situation.
